properties.text: I have not ever seen my father's grave. Not that his judgment eyes have been forgotten nor his great hands' print on our evening doorknobs one half turn each night and he would come drabbled with the world's business massive and silent as the whole day's wish ready to redefine each of our shapes but now the evening doorknobs wait and do not recognize us as we pass.

Each week a different woman regular as his one quick glass each evening pulls up the grass his stillness grows calling it weed. Each week a different woman has my mother's face and he who time has changeless must be amazed who knew and loved but one.

My father died in silence loving creation and well-defined response he lived still judgments on familiar things and died knowing a January 15th that year me. Lest I go into dust I have not ever seen my father's grave.
